Welcome to my blog!

int main(void) {
    printf("Hello, world!")
}
internet@earth:~$ echo "Hello, Simon!"

I finally decided to redo my website and as part of it, I want to keep a written record of some of the problems I encounter in my work and personal projects as well as other musings and ideas (what netizens used to call a weblog). I know, I know... it's 2019 and most people don't have blogs anymore but publish on Medium, or write something lengthy and then upload a picture of it to Instagram or Twitter or new_social_platform_name. I'll probably cross-post some things but most of my posts will have a home here.

I'm interested and sometimes even knowledgeable in a wide variety of topics: programming, software engineering best practices, entrepreneurship, rowing, sports physiology and training planning, health care more broadly, science and science fiction, especially things related to space exploration, economics and finance, and I can't help it... self-helpy and motivational things.

In case you were wondering, this website was built with GatsbyJS. If you know React and you're interested in building a static site that's inexpensive to host and easy to maintain, I'd recommend you take a look at the documentation. In a future post, I might give a quick rundown of how I put this modest website together if folks are interested.
